newsitem.title: PERU: Peru March inflation 1.27 pct vs 1.38 pct yr ago.
newsitem.headline: Peru March inflation 1.27 pct vs 1.38 pct yr ago.

text.p: Peruvian consumer prices rose 1.27 percent in March, compared with a 1.38 percent rise in the same month last year and a 0.09 percent rise in February, the government's statistics agency said Tuesday.
Prices increased 1.85 percent in the period January-March, the National Institute for Statistics and Information (INEI) said. It gave no comparative figures for the same period last year.
Consumer prices in Peru rose 11.8 percent in 1996, compared with a 10.2 percent rise in 1995.
The government estimates accumulated inflation will be nine percent this year and will drop to "the level of industrialized countries" by 2000.
